reviews.review: Down here, salt is a way of life...

CS:GO is a classic game, that challenges you and allows you to learn and compete at your level, unless you run into smurfs. The game's worst, but also the best aspect has to be the community. As with any competitive game, people can get very... passionate about their game, which can be off-putting to some new players.
Впринципе если играть на прайме то читеры попадаются меньше
Absolutely toxic and annoying community filled with hackers, yet oddly satisfying and fun.

I think that Counter-Strike: Global Offensive was a good game. Then the developers went sicko mode so if you are trying to just pick this game up now, all I can say is good luck to you, sir.

If you do manage to get past the start with all the hackers and you manage to get prime matchmaking, that would greatly help out your experience, however I am sure that this is where most people get put off.

Fun game. Semi tough learning curve. Luck of the draw on teammates in competetive.

I have played this game for 1,000+ hours and over 400 wins. So, I know a bit about what I am talking about. I think that it is an overall fun and competitive game. It has driven me to put the most time into it and it is extremely addictive. It is a great game, but it is not perfect. Two of the major flaws in the game right now are the ranking system and hacking.  The ranking system used to be very good. I would always be in my skill rank, but now it is terrible. I just played a game with silvers, globals, and LEMs. The latter two ranks were very high and were not supposed to be in my game. Now for the hacking point. I run into hackers weekly now. It is a major problem and spans from b-hop scripts to spinbot, aimbot, and no-clip. I have ran into everything, and it seems to be getting worse since CSGO was made free to play (I have prime of course). I would recommend this game to anyone, but I just wanted to make it perfectly clear that the game is flawed and getting worse. Good game though!
